title.name: title
title.label: title
title.hover_text:
A short title that contains a meaningful summary of the activity. This may be repeated for different languages.

Click here for more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter a title for this activity. For example: "Water for Women Malawi"

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

reporting_org.name: reporting_org
reporting_org.label: reporting org
reporting_org.hover_text:
The organisation that is publishing data. If a primary reporter, the organisation is publishing data about itself. If a secondary reporter, it is publishing on the activities of another organisation.

Click here for more information
reporting_org.helper_text: Reporting Organisation data is managed via the Organisation Tab , except for value Secondary Reporter which can be managed at each activity.

ref.name: ref
ref.label: reference
ref.hover_text: Provide your organisation's IATI identifier. This was entered when you registered with IATI.

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text: Select the type that best describes your organisation.

secondary_reporter.name: secondary_reporter
secondary_reporter.label: secondary reporter
secondary_reporter.hover_text: If you are publishing data about your own organisation, select 'False'. If you are publishing data about another organisation, and are not officially assigned to report on its behalf, select 'True'.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: name
narrative.hover_text: Enter your organisation's name. This can be repeated in multiple languages.

lang.name: language
lang.label: language
lang.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

activity_identifier.name: activity_identifier
activity_identifier.label: activity-identifier
activity_identifier.hover_text:
Enter a unique series of letters or numbers to identify your activity - e.g. "PROJECT-00120467" or "AFG-COVAX". Each of your activities must have a unique identifier. Once you have published an activity, its IATI identifier will not change.

Click here for more information

iati_identifier_text.name: iati_identifier_text
iati_identifier_text.label: iati identifier
iati_identifier_text.hover_text:
Enter a unique series of letters or numbers to identify your activity - e.g. "PROJECT-00120467" or "AFG-COVAX". Each of your activities must have a unique identifier. Once you have published an activity, its IATI identifier will not change.

Click here for more information

other_identifier.name: other_identifier
other_identifier.label: other identifier
other_identifier.hover_text:
Another identifier for the activity. This may be an identifier internal to your organisation that you want to record with the activity, or your previous organisation identifier if this has changed.

Click here for more information

reference.name: reference
reference.label: reference
reference.hover_text: Enter the other identifier related to this activity.

reference_type.name: reference_type
reference_type.label: type
reference_type.hover_text: Select which type of identifier you are providing.

owner_org.name: owner_org
owner_org.label: owner org
owner_org.hover_text: Where applicable, this is the organisation that owns the other identifier being reported. This may be your own organisation.

ref.name: ref
ref.label: reference
ref.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide a description of the other identifier for the activity.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

description.name: description
description.label: description
description.hover_text:
A longer description that explains what the activity is. This may be repeated in multiple languages.

Click here for more information

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text:
Select the type of description that you are providing.

Click here for information on description types

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter a description for your activity.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

activity_status.label: activity status
activity_status.hover_text: The activity status describes which stage of implementation the activity is currently at. You can publish activities that are already completed, currently happening or not yet started. As the activity progresses over time, the activity status should be updated.

activity_status.name: activity_status
activity_status.label: code
activity_status.hover_text:
An IATI code defining the current status of the activity.

Click here for more information on activity statuses

activity_date.name: activity_date
activity_date.label: activity date
activity_date.hover_text:
The start and end dates of the activity. Start dates may reflect the beginning of funding, planning or physical activity. End dates should, wherever possible, reflect the ending of physical activity.

Click here for more information

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text: Select the type of activity date that you are entering.

date.name: date
date.label: iso date
date.hover_text: Enter the relevant date for your activity.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide any accompanying information or explanation for your chosen activity date.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

activity_scope.label: activity scope
activity_scope.hover_text: The geographical scope of the activity: regional, national, sub-national, etc.

activity_scope.name: activity_scope
activity_scope.label: code
activity_scope.hover_text:
Select an option that best describes the scope of this activity.

Click here for more information on activity scopes

recipient_country.name: recipient_country
recipient_country.label: recipient country
recipient_country.hover_text:
A country that will benefit from this activity. If a specific country is not known, the 'recipient-region' element should be used instead. Multiple countries and regions can be reported, in which case the percentage share of total commitments across all reported countries and regions must total 100%. Recipient country can also be specified at transaction rather than activity level.

Click here for more information

country_code.name: country_code
country_code.label: code
country_code.hover_text: Select a country benefitting from this activity.

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.label: percentage
percentage.hover_text: The percentage of total commitments or total activity budget benefitting this country. This should be a number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign. Percentages for all reported countries and regions must add up to 100% for the activity.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Add an optional name or description of the country benefitting from the activity.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

recipient_region.name: recipient_region
recipient_region.label: recipient region
recipient_region.hover_text:
If you cannot identify specific countries benefitting from this activity, then you should provide the region instead. You can specify multiple recipient countries and regions, provided the total percentage across them totals 100%.

Click here for more information

region_vocabulary.name: region_vocabulary
region_vocabulary.label: vocabulary
region_vocabulary.hover_text:
You can select regions from the 'OECD DAC', 'UN' or your own internal codelist. IATI recommends that you use the 'OECD DAC' codelist. If you do not choose an option, then the codelist 'OECD DAC' is assumed.

Click here for more information on these codelists.

region_code.name: region_code
region_code.label: code
region_code.hover_text: Select the region benefitting from this activity. If vocabulary ‘99 - Reporting Organisation' has been selected, enter a code from your own region list.

custom_code.name: custom_code
custom_code.label: code
custom_code.hover_text: Select the region benefitting from this activity. If vocabulary ‘99 - Reporting Organisation' has been selected, enter a code from your own region list.

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: vocabulary uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: If you have selected the vocabulary ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’, provide a link to where this internal list is defined.

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.label: percentage
percentage.hover_text: The percentage of total commitments or total activity budget benefitting this region. This should be a number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign. Percentages for all reported countries and regions must add up to 100% for the activity. For example, if you know that 80% of funding is going to Uganda, you can specify that the unknown 20% is going to the region of Africa.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Add an optional name or description of the region benefitting from the activity.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

sector.label: sector
sector.name: sector
sector.hover_text:
Information on the sector that the activity targets or supports, such as primary education or agriculture. You must select at least one sector and can have multiple.

Click here for more information

sector_vocabulary.name: sector_vocabulary
sector_vocabulary.label: vocabulary
sector_vocabulary.hover_text: Choose the codelist that you will select sectors from. IATI recommends using the OECD DAC 5-digit sector codelist. If you want to use your organisation’s own list of internal sector classifications, select the option: ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’.

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: vocabulary-uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: If you have chosen to use an internal sector classification codelist, provide a link to where this is defined.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: Select the sector that the activity is targeting or supporting. You can choose more than one sector.

text.name: text
text.label: code
text.hover_text: Select the sector that the activity is targeting or supporting. You can choose more than one sector.

category_code.name: category_code
category_code.label: code
category_code.hover_text: Select the sector that the activity is targeting or supporting. You can choose more than one sector.

sdg_goal.name: sdg_goal
sdg_goal.label: code
sdg_goal.hover_text: Select the sector that the activity is targeting or supporting. You can choose more than one sector.

sdg_target.name: sdg_target
sdg_target.label: code
sdg_target.hover_text: Select the sector that the activity is targeting or supporting. You can choose more than one sector.

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.label: percentage
percentage.hover_text: If you have selected more than one sector (from the same list), each sector must be given a percentage. For example, using the OECD DAC 5-digit sector codelist, you can allocate 50% of the activity's funding to ‘teacher training’ (11130) and 50% to ‘primary education’ (11220). The percentage should be a number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: If you have chosen a sector from an internal classification codelist, please provide a description of this sector.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

tag.name: tag
tag.label: tag
tag.hover_text: You can provide other useful information about your activity by ‘tagging’ it using categorisations such as the UN Sustainable Development Goal(s). Unlike categorisations reported in the 'sector' element, tags are not associated with percentage splits on finances.

tag_vocabulary.name: tag_vocabulary
tag_vocabulary.label: vocabulary
tag_vocabulary.hover_text: Select the vocabulary or taxonomy used for tag classifications. You may choose to tag your activity according to an internal category list by choosing ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’.

goals_tag_code.name: goals_tag_code
goals_tag_code.label: code
goals_tag_code.hover_text: Choose a category from the list you have selected.

targets_tag_code.name: targets_tag_code
targets_tag_code.label: code
targets_tag_code.hover_text: Choose a category from the list you have selected.

tag_text.name: tag_text
tag_text.label: code
tag_text.hover_text: Choose a category from the list you have selected.

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: vocabulary uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: Provide a link to your chosen list.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: You can provide additional information on the category that you have chosen.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

policy_marker.name: policy_marker
policy_marker.label: policy marker
policy_marker.hover_text:
You can provide information about the policy or theme addressed by your activity, such as 'disability' or 'nutrition'. An activity can have multiple policy markers.

Click here for more information

policy_marker_vocabulary.name: policy_marker_vocabulary
policy_marker_vocabulary.label: vocabulary
policy_marker_vocabulary.hover_text:
Select a list that includes the policy marker(s) related to your activity.

1 - OECD DAC CRS - IATI recommends that you select this list which has 12 options to choose from.

99 - Reporting Organisation - choose this option if you want to use a policy marker that is defined and tracked by your organisation.

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: vocabulary uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: If you have selected the vocabulary '99 - Reporting Organisation', provide a link to where your organisation's policy markers are listed.

significance.name: significance
significance.label: significance
significance.hover_text:
If you have chosen a policy marker from the OECD DAC CRS list, indicate here how significant it is for your activity.

Click here for more information on the significance levels

policy_marker.name: policy_marker
policy_marker.label: code
policy_marker.hover_text: Provide the code for the policy or theme addressed by your activity.

policy_marker_text.name: policy_marker_text
policy_marker_text.label: code
policy_marker_text.hover_text: Provide the code for the policy or theme addressed by your activity.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: If you have selected vocabulary '99 - Reporting Organisation', please provide a description for the policy marker that you have chosen.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

collaboration_type.label: collaboration type
collaboration_type.hover_text:
The type of collaboration involved in the activity’s funding disbursements, e.g. “bilateral” or “multilateral”.

Click here for more information

collaboration_type.name: collaboration_type
collaboration_type.label: code
collaboration_type.hover_text: Select a collaboration type, if applicable to your activity.

default_flow_type.label: default flow type
default_flow_type.hover_text:
Flow type is a way to categorise financial flows. It distinguishes between official development assistance (ODA), other official flows (OOF), or several types of private flows.

Click here for more information

default_flow_type.name: default_flow_type
default_flow_type.label: code
default_flow_type.hover_text: If this activity’s funds can be classified by one of these options, make a selection here. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

default_finance_type.label: default finance type
default_finance_type.hover_text:
The financial instrument that is being used for this activity. For example, financing is most commonly delivered as a grant or a loan.

Click here for more information

default_finance_type.name: default_finance_type
default_finance_type.label: code
default_finance_type.hover_text: Select the finance type that best applies to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

default_aid_type.name: default_aid_type
default_aid_type.label: default aid type
default_aid_type.hover_text:
The type of aid being supplied (project-type intervention, budget support, debt relief, etc.).

Click here for more information

default_aid_type_vocabulary.name: default_aid_type_vocabulary
default_aid_type_vocabulary.label: vocabulary
default_aid_type_vocabulary.hover_text: Select a list that includes the aid type for your activity, if applicable. You can choose to select an aid type from more than one list.

default_aid_type.name: default_aid_type
default_aid_type.label: code
default_aid_type.hover_text: Select the aid type most relevant to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

earmarking_category.name: earmarking_category
earmarking_category.label: code
earmarking_category.hover_text: Select the aid type most relevant to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

earmarking_modality.name: earmarking_modality
earmarking_modality.label: code
earmarking_modality.hover_text: Select the aid type most relevant to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

cash_and_voucher_modalities.name: cash_and_voucher_modalities
cash_and_voucher_modalities.label: code
cash_and_voucher_modalities.hover_text: Select the aid type most relevant to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

default_tied_status.label: default tied status
default_tied_status.hover_text:
Whether funding is untied, tied, or partially tied. Tied funding must be spent on goods or services procured from a particular country or group of countries.

Click here for more information

default_tied_status.name: default_tied_status
default_tied_status.label: code
default_tied_status.hover_text: Select the tied status most relevant to your activity. This the default value for all transactions of the activity; it can be overridden for individual transactions if needed.

country_budget_items.name: country_budget_items
country_budget_items.label: country-budget-items
country_budget_items.hover_text:
Alignment of the activity with the functional and administrative classifications used in the recipient country’s Chart of Accounts.

Click here for more information

country_budget_vocabulary.name: country_budget_vocabulary
country_budget_vocabulary.label: vocabulary
country_budget_vocabulary.hover_text: An IATI code for the common functional classification or country system.

budget_item.name: budget_item
budget_item.label: budget item
budget_item.hover_text: Identifier for a single item in the recipient country budget. If more than one identifier is reported, the percentage share must be reported and all percentages should add up to 100%.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: Select a code for the budget item from the vocabulary specified.

percentage.name: percentage
percentage.label: percentage
percentage.hover_text: When multiple budget items are declared, the percentage values should add up to 100% for each vocabulary used.

description.name: description
description.label: description
description.hover_text: A longer description of the budget item that may be repeated in different languages.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

humanitarian_scope.name: humanitarian_scope
humanitarian_scope.label: Humanitarian scope
humanitarian_scope.hover_text:
You can use this section to specify the emergency or appeal that your activity is responding to.

Click here for more information

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text:
Select which type of information you can provide:

Emergencies (type 1)
Select this option if you can provide the GLIDE number for the specific humanitarian emergency that your activity is responding to. Alternatively, you can declare a code for the emergency from another public list.

Appeals (type 2)
Select this option if your activity is contributing to a UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) Humanitarian Response Plan or Flash Appeal. These codes are created by UN OCHA for use in their Financial Tracking Service (FTS). Alternatively, you can declare a code for the appeal from another public list.

vocabulary.name: vocabulary
vocabulary.label: vocabulary
vocabulary.hover_text:
Select the list that you will use to identify the emergency or appeal that your activity is responding to:

1-2 -Glide
2-1 -Humanitarian Plan
99 - Reporting Organisation - select this option if you can declare a code for the emergency or appeal from an alternative public list.

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: vocabulary uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: Provide a link to the list of emergencies or appeals that you will use, which includes its codes and descriptions.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text:
Provide the code for the specific emergency or appeal that your activity is responding to.

For example, if you are providing a code for an emergency that has a Glide Number, the format for this code would be: [Emergency Type] + [Year] + [Number] + [Country].

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: If you have used a code for the emergency or appeal from an alternative public list (i.e. you have selected '99 - Reporting Organisation' above), please provide a description of the code that you have specified.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

capital_spend.label: capital spend
capital_spend.hover_text:
The percentage of the activity's funding that is for capital spending. Capital describes physical assets with a useful life of more than one year - for example, a road.

Click here for more information

capital_spend.name: capital_spend
capital_spend.label: percentage
capital_spend.hover_text: Enter the percentage of funding allocated to capital expenditure. This should be a decimal number between 0 and 100 inclusive, with no percentage sign.

related_activity.name: related_activity
related_activity.label: related-activity
related_activity.hover_text:
A separately reported IATI activity that is related to this one. The ‘type’ attribute describes the type of relationship - e.g. parent, child, multifunded. Please only refer to your own activities here.

Click here for more information

activity_identifier.name: activity_identifier
activity_identifier.label: reference
activity_identifier.hover_text: A valid activity identifier (as defined in iati-activity/iati-identifier).

relationship_type.name: relationship_type
relationship_type.label: type
relationship_type.hover_text:
Select the type of relationship between the activity being reported and the related activity from this list.

Click here for descriptions of the different types

conditions.name: conditions
conditions.label: conditions
conditions.hover_text:
Specific terms and conditions attached to the activity that may influence the delivery of commitments.

Click here for more information

condition_attached.name: condition_attached
condition_attached.label: attached
condition_attached.hover_text: Select ‘True’ if your activity has a condition attached, otherwise 'False'.

condition.name: condition
condition.label: Condition
condition.hover_text: Information on a specific condition attached to the activity. Organisation-wide terms and conditions that apply to all activities should be reported in the 'document-link' element of your organisation data instead of here.

condition_type.name: condition_type
condition_type.label: type
condition_type.hover_text:
Select the type of condition that you want to report.

Click here for more information on the different types

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide a short description of the condition here. You can provide more information by adding a link to a document or webpage in the separate activity 'document-link' element.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

legacy_data.name: legacy_data
legacy_data.label: legacy-data
legacy_data.hover_text:
You can link this activity to your organisation’s internal data and record which IATI Standard element it relates to.

Click here for more information

legacy_name.name: legacy_name
legacy_name.label: name
legacy_name.hover_text: The original field name in your organisation's internal data system.

value.name: value
value.label: value
value.hover_text: The original value in the reporting organisation’s system

iati_equivalent.name: iati_equivalent
iati_equivalent.label: iati-equivalent
iati_equivalent.hover_text: The name of the equivalent IATI element.

document_link.name: document_link
document_link.label: document link
document_link.hover_text:
A link to an online, publicly accessible, web page or document. For example, you could provide a link to your activity's website or an evaluation report. Create additional document elements for each separate document.

Click here for more information

url.name: url
url.label: url
url.hover_text: A link to where the document is available online - e.g. 'http://www.example.org/doc.odt'

format.name: format
format.label: format
format.hover_text: Select the document file format from the drop-down list. For example, a PDF file could be 'application/pdf'.

title.name: title
title.label: Title
title.hover_text: A short title for the document.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide a short title for the document or webpage.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

category.name: category
category.label: category
category.hover_text: A category that describes the type of document. You can select multiple categories.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: Select a category from the drop-down menu that describes what your document is.

description.name: description
description.label: description
description.hover_text: A description of the document contents, or guidance on where to access relevant information.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide a short description of the document or webpage, including any instructions on where to find relevant information.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: Select the language that the document is written in. This can be repeated to describe multilingual documents.

document_date.name: document_date
document_date.label: document date
document_date.hover_text: The publication date of the document or webpage.

date.name: date
date.label: date
date.hover_text: Provide the date of publication for the document, or the date that it was last updated.

contact_info.name: contact_info
contact_info.label: contact info
contact_info.hover_text:
Contact information for the activity. You can add multiple points of contact if needed.

Click here for more information

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text: Select the category that best describes the type of contact information that you are providing.

organisation.name: organisation
organisation.label: organisation
organisation.hover_text: An organisation to contact for more information about the activity.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter the name of the organisation.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

department.name: department
department.label: department
department.hover_text: A department within the organisation to contact for more information about the activity.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide the name of the department.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

person_name.name: person_name
person_name.label: person name
person_name.hover_text: A person to contact for more information about the activity.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter the name of the contact person.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

job_title.name: job_title
job_title.label: job title
job_title.hover_text: The job title of the contact person at the organisation.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter a job title.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

telephone.name: telephone
telephone.label: telephone
telephone.hover_text: A contact telephone number for the activity. Multiple numbers may be entered.

email.name: email
email.label: email
email.hover_text: A contact email address for the activity. Multiple email addresses may be entered.

website.name: website
website.label: website
website.hover_text: A website for the activity. Multiple websites may be entered.

mailing_address.name: mailing_address
mailing_address.label: mailing address
mailing_address.hover_text: A contact mailing address for the activity.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter a physical address.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

location.name: location
location.label: location
location.hover_text:
The sub-national location of an activity, if known and safe to disclose. You can provide geographic coordinates, an administrative area, or general description. Multiple locations may be reported.

Click here for more information

ref.name: ref
ref.label: reference
ref.hover_text: You can provide an internal reference used by your organisation to describe the location.

location_reach.name: location_reach
location_reach.label: location reach
location_reach.hover_text: Does this location describe where the activity takes place or where the intended beneficiaries reside?

location_id.name: location_id
location_id.label: location-id
location_id.hover_text:
A unique code describing the location according to a recognised gazetteer or administrative boundary repository.

Click here for more information

vocabulary.name: vocabulary
vocabulary.label: vocabulary
vocabulary.hover_text: Select a recognised gazetteer or administrative boundary repository from the drop-down list.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: Provide a location code which corresponds to the vocabulary that you have selected.

name.name: name
name.label: name
name.hover_text: A name for the location of the activity.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter a location name.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

description.name: description
description.label: description
description.hover_text: A description of the location of the activity.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter a location description.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

activity_description.name: activity_description
activity_description.label: activity description
activity_description.hover_text: A description of what is taking place at this location. This should not duplicate information provided in the main activity description. It is typically used to distinguish work at multiple locations within a single IATI activity.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Describe what activity is happening at this location.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

administrative.name: administrative
administrative.label: administrative
administrative.hover_text: Identification of national and sub-national locations according to recognised administrative boundary repositories.

vocabulary.name: vocabulary
vocabulary.label: vocabulary
vocabulary.hover_text: Select an administrative boundary list to use for your activity location.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: Provide a code from your chosen administrative boundary list.

level.name: level
level.label: level
level.hover_text: Within your chosen administrative boundary list, you can provide a number to define a hierarchical subdivision. This will depend on the administrative vocabulary in use.

point.name: point
point.label: point
point.hover_text:
Geo-coordinates for the location, in the format of latitude and longitude coordinates.

Click here for more information

srs_name.name: srs_name
srs_name.label: srsName
srs_name.hover_text: The name of the spatial reference system used by the coordinates.

pos.name: pos
pos.hover_text:
The latitude and longitude coordinates.

Click here for more information on finding coordinates

exactness.name: exactness
exactness.label: exactness
exactness.hover_text: Defines whether the location represents the most distinct point reasonably possible for this type of activity or is an approximation due to lack of more detailed information.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: If you have provided the geo-coordinates for the activity location, then select an option from the Geographic Exactness list to specify whether the location is exact or approximate.

location_class.name: location_class
location_class.label: location class
location_class.hover_text:
Whether the location refers to a structure, a populated place (e.g. city or village), an administrative division, or another topological feature (e.g. river, nature reserve).

Click here for more information

feature_designation.name: feature_designation
feature_designation.label: feature designation
feature_designation.hover_text: A more refined coded classification of the type of feature referred to by this location.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text:
You can provide more detail on the type of activity location (e.g. beach, well or college).

Click here for more information on location types

planned_disbursement.name: planned_disbursement
planned_disbursement.label: planned disbursement
planned_disbursement.hover_text: Planned disbursements allow you to publish predefined payment schedules. They should be reported for a specific date or period, and should not replace the activity’s budget.

planned_disbursement_type.name: planned_disbursement_type
planned_disbursement_type.label: type
planned_disbursement_type.hover_text: Specify if this is an ‘original’ planned disbursement (prepared when the original commitment was made) or has subsequently been ‘revised’.

period_start.name: period_start
period_start.label: period start
period_start.hover_text: The exact date of the planned disbursement OR the starting date of the period in which this disbursement will be made.

period_end.name: period_end
period_end.label: period end
period_end.hover_text: The end date for the period in which this disbursement will be made.

value.name: value
value.label: value
value.hover_text: The amount that is planned to be disbursed in the specified currency.

currency.name: currency
currency.label: currency
currency.help_text: If no currency is selected, your default currency is assumed.

value_date.name: value_date
value_date.label: value date
value_date.hover_text: Enter the date that the planned disbursement was agreed. This will be used to determine the exchange rate for currency conversions.

provider_org.name: provider_org
provider_org.label: provider organisation
provider_org.hover_text: Will your organisation be disbursing these funds? If so, then you are the provider organisation. If not, please provide information on the organisation who will be disbursing these funds.

ref.name: ref
ref.label: reference
ref.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an organisation identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

provider_activity_id.name: provider_activity_id
provider_activity_id.label: provider-activity-id
provider_activity_id.hover_text:
The provider organisation may have published IATI data on providing these funds in their own activity. If so, you can enter the unique identifier for that activity here.

Click here for further guidance

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text: Select the type that best describes the provider organisation.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter the name of the organisation. This can be repeated in multiple languages.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

receiver_org.name: receiver_org
receiver_org.label: receiver organisation
receiver_org.hover_text: Provide information about the organisation that will receive the funds.

ref.name: ref
ref.label: reference
ref.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an organisation identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

receiver_activity_id.name: receiver_activity_id
receiver_activity_id.label: receiver-activity-id
receiver_activity_id.hover_text:
The receiver organisation may have published IATI data on receiving these funds in their own activity. If so, you can enter the unique identifier for that activity here.

Click here for further guidance

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text: Select the type that best describes the receiver organisation.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter the name of the organisation. This can be repeated in multiple languages.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

participating_org.name: participating_org
participating_org.label: participating organization
participating_org.hover_text: Specify which organisations are involved in this activity and what their roles are. For example, they could be a funder or implementing agency.

organization_role.name: organization_role
organization_role.label: role
organization_role.hover_text: Select an option that describes the organisation’s role in the activity.

ref.name: ref
ref.label: reference
ref.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an organisation identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text: Select the type that best describes the participating organisation.

identifier.name: identifier
identifier.label: activity-id
identifier.hover_text:
The participating organisation may have published their own IATI activity for this funding. If so, you can enter the unique identifier for that activity here.

Click here for further guidance

crs_channel_code.name: crs_channel_code
crs_channel_code.label: crs-channel-code
crs_channel_code.hover_text:
Under CRS++ Reporting Directives, this code identifies the implementing agency. Codes ending in ‘00’ are generic and are similar to the OrganisationType code.

Click here for more information

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: name
narrative.hover_text: Enter the name of the organisation. This can be repeated in multiple languages.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

budget.name: budget
budget.label: budget
budget.hover_text:
The value of the activity’s budget for each financial quarter or year over the lifetime of the activity.

Click here for more information

budget_status.name: budget_status
budget_status.label: status
budget_status.hover_text:
Select a status that best describes this budget:

(1) indicative - a non-binding estimate for the described budget.

(2) committed - a binding agreement for the described budget.

If no status is selected, the budget is assumed to be indicative.

budget_type.name: budget_type
budget_type.label: type
budget_type.hover_text: Whether this is the original budget (prepared when the original commitment was made), or one that has been subsequently revised.

period_start.name: period_start
period_start.label: period-start
period_start.hover_text: The start date of the budget period.

period_end.name: period_end
period_end.label: period-end
period_end.hover_text: The end date of the budget period. This cannot be greater than one year from the start date.

budget_value.name: budget_value
budget_value.label: value
budget_value.hover_text: The total value of the activity's budget for this period.

currency.name: currency
currency.label: currency
currency.help_text: If no currency is selected, your default currency is assumed.

value_date.name: value_date
value_date.label: value-date
value_date.hover_text: The date used to determine the exchange rate for currency conversions.

result.name: result
result.label: result
result.hover_text:
An output, outcome, impact or other intended benefit from the activity. Multiple results can be added and each must have at least one indicator.

Click here for more information

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text: Select the type of result that your activity is aiming to achieve.

aggregation_status.name: aggregation_status
aggregation_status.label: aggregation-status
aggregation_status.hover_text: Select 'true' if the results data that you provide is suitable for aggregation. This means that a data user can add it up to get to the total.

title.name: title
title.label: title
title.hover_text: A short title for the result.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide a title for the result. An example is "People have access to independent media covering a diverse range of outcomes".

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

description.name: description
description.label: description
description.hover_text: A longer description of the result.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter a result description.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

document_link.name: document_link
document_link.label: document-link
document_link.hover_text: A link to an online, publicly accessible, web page or document. Create additional document elements for each separate document.

url.name: url
url.label: url
url.hover_text: A link to where the document is available online - e.g. 'http://www.example.org/doc.odt'

format.name: format
format.label: format
format.hover_text: Select the document file format from the drop-down list. For example, a PDF file could be 'application/pdf'.

title.name: title
title.label: title
title.hover_text: A short title for the document.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide a short title for the document or webpage.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

category.name: category
category.label: category
category.hover_text: A category that describes the type of document. You can select multiple categories.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: Select a category from the drop-down menu that describes what your document is.

description.name: description
description.label: description
description.hover_text: A description of the document contents, or guidance on where to access relevant information.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide a short description of the document or webpage, including any instructions on where to find relevant information.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

language.name: language
language.label: code
language.hover_text: Select the language that the document is written in. This can be repeated to describe multilingual documents.

document_date.name: document_date
document_date.label: document-date
document_date.hover_text: The publication date of the document or webpage.

date.name: date
date.label: date
date.hover_text: Provide the date of publication for the document, or the date that it was last updated.

reference.name: reference
reference.label: reference
reference.hover_text:
If this result is part of a results framework, you can either provide a reference to it here, or provide a reference for each indicator that measures this result. You cannot provide a reference at both the result and indicator level.

Click here for more information

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: Enter a code that identifies the results framework.

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: vocabulary uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: Enter a public link to the results framework.

indicator.name: indicator
indicator.label: indicator
indicator.hover_text:
An indicator is used to measure progress against the result. Each result must have at least one indiciator.

Click here for more information

measure.name: measure
measure.label: measure
measure.hover_text: Select the unit of measurement for the indicator.

ascending.name: ascending
ascending.label: ascending
ascending.hover_text: If your indicator is a numerical (quantitative) measure, select 'true' if a high number shows improvement and 'false' if the opposite.

aggregation_status.name: aggregation_status
aggregation_status.label: aggregation status
aggregation_status.hover_text: Select 'true' if the results data that you provide is suitable for aggregation. This means that a data user can add it up to get to the total.

title.name: title
title.label: title
title.hover_text: A short title for the indicator.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide a title or brief description of the indicator. An example is “The percentage of journalists who feel free to express their opinion (scoring 3 or 4 with a scale of 1 - 4)".

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

description.name: description
description.label: description
description.hover_text: A longer description of the indicator.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: You can provide a description or additional information to help explain what is being measured by this indicator and how.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

document_link.name: document_link

date.name: date
date.label: date
date.hover_text: Provide the date of publication for the document, or the date that it was last updated.

reference.name: reference
reference.label: reference
reference.hover_text:
If this indicator is part of a results framework, you can provide a reference to it here. Note that you cannot provide a results framework reference at both the result and indicator level.

Click here for more information

vocabulary.name: vocabulary
vocabulary.label: vocabulary
vocabulary.hover_text: Select the results framework that your indicator is included in. If the results framework is not listed, select ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: If you selected a results framework, provide the code for the indicator as specified in this framework.

indicator_uri.name: indicator_uri
indicator_uri.label: indicator uri
indicator_uri.hover_text: If you selected '99 - Reporting Organisation', it is recommended that you include a link to the results framework here. This helps data users to understand the meaning of the codes used.

baseline.name: baseline
baseline.label: baseline
baseline.hover_text:
The starting value for the indicator.

Click here for more guidance on results

year.name: year
year.label: year
year.hover_text: Provide the year when the indicator’s baseline was measured.

date.name: date
date.label: date
date.hover_text: Provide the date when the indicator’s baseline was measured.

value.name: value
value.label: value
value.hover_text: Provide the indicator's baseline value. Do not include the unit of measure (eg. "%") as this is specified separately in the 'measure' field. If the indicator is qualitative, leave this value blank and add your baseline in the 'comment' field below instead.

comment.name: comment
comment.label: comment
comment.hover_text: If the indicator is a qualitative measure, provide a descriptive baseline here. If the indicator is quantitative, you can add other information here such as how the baseline is measured.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

dimension.name: dimension
dimension.label: dimension
dimension.hover_text: A category used for disaggregating the result, for example by gender or age. Multiple disaggregations can be added.

name.name: name
name.label: name
name.hover_text: Enter a description of the category being disaggregated. For example, an activity could declare the dimension’s name as ‘sex’, with a value of ‘female’.

value.name: value
value.label: value
value.hover_text: Specify a disaggregated value for this category.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Provide a short description of the document or webpage, including any instructions on where to find relevant information.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.hover_text: Select the language that the document is written in. This can be repeated to describe multilingual documents.

document_date.name: document_date
document_date.label: document-date
document_date.hover_text: The publication date of the document or webpage.

date.name: date
date.label: date
date.hover_text: Provide the date of publication for the document, or the date that it was last updated.

reference.name: reference
reference.label: reference
reference.hover_text: A cross-reference to a location specified in 'iati-activity/location/@ref'

transactions.name: transaction
transactions.label: transaction
transactions.hover_text:
Transactions record committed or actual funds flowing in or out of your activity. Each incoming or outgoing flow should be published as a transaction.

See guidance on publishing financial transactions

reference.name: reference
reference.label: reference
reference.hover_text: You can provide a reference that you use to identify this transaction in your organisation’s internal financial management system

humanitarian.name: humanitarian
humanitarian.label: humanitarian
humanitarian.hover_text:
If this transaction relates entirely or partially to humanitarian aid, select 'True'. If the entire activity relates to humanitarian aid, you should use the humanitarian flag at the activity level rather than transaction level.

See guidance on how to publish humanitarian data

transaction_type.name: transaction_type
transaction_type.label: transaction type
transaction_type.hover_text: The type of transaction that best reflects the flow of money in or out of your organisation.

transaction_type_code.name: transaction_type_code
transaction_type_code.label: code
transaction_type_code.hover_text:
Select the type that best describes this transaction.

Click here for more information on the different types

transaction_date.name: transaction_date
transaction_date.label: transaction date
transaction_date.hover_text: The date that the transaction was made or, in the case of commitments, agreed. This date cannot be in the future.

value.name: value
value.label: value
value.hover_text: The transaction amount. Transactions can be positive or, in the case of returned funds, negative.

date.name: date
date.label: value date
date.hover_text: The date used to determine the exchange rate for currency conversions.

currency.name: currency
currency.label: currency
currency.help_text: If no currency is selected, your default currency is assumed.

description.name: description
description.label: description
description.hover_text: A short description of the transaction, for example, describing what it was for.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter a transaction description.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

provider_organization.name: provider_organization
provider_organization.label: provider organisation
provider_organization.hover_text: The organisation that provided funds for this transaction. If this is your own organisation, enter its details here.

organization_identifer_code.name: organization_identifier_code
organization_identifer_code.label: reference
organization_identifer_code.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

provider_activity_id.name: provider_activity_id
provider_activity_id.label: provider-activity-id
provider_activity_id.hover_text:
The provider organisation may have published IATI data on providing these funds in their own activity. If so, you can enter the unique identifier for that activity here.

Click here for further guidance

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text: Select the type that best describes the provider organisation.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter the name of the organisation. This can be repeated in multiple languages.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

receiver_organization.name: receiver_organization
receiver_organization.label: receiver-organisation
receiver_organization.hover_text: The organisation that received funds from this transaction. If this is your own organisation, enter its details here.

organization_identifier_code.name: organization_identifier_code
organization_identifier_code.label: reference
organization_identifier_code.hover_text:
Enter the organisation’s IATI organisation identifier. If you cannot provide an identifier then you must provide the name of the organisation.

Click here for information on how to find other organisations' identifiers.

receiver_activity_id.name: receiver_activity_id
receiver_activity_id.label: receiver-activity-id
receiver_activity_id.hover_text:
The receiver organisation may have published IATI data on receiving these funds in their own activity. If so, you can enter the unique identifier for that activity here.

Click here for further guidance

type.name: type
type.label: type
type.hover_text: Select the type that best describes the receiver organisation.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Enter the name of the organisation. This can be repeated in multiple languages.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

disbursement_channel.name: disbursement_channel
disbursement_channel.label: disbursement-channel
disbursement_channel.hover_text: The channel through which the funds will flow for this transaction.

disbursement_channel_code.name: disbursement_channel_code
disbursement_channel_code.label: code
disbursement_channel_code.hover_text: Select the best option for how your disbursements are channeled.

sector.label: sector
sector.name: sector
sector.hover_text: Information on the sector that this transaction targets or supports, such as primary education or agriculture. If you choose to define sectors at transaction level, rather than activity level, you must provide a sector for every transaction.

sector_vocabulary.name: sector_vocabulary
sector_vocabulary.label: vocabulary
sector_vocabulary.hover_text: Choose the codelist that you will select sectors from. IATI recommends using the OECD DAC 5-digit sector codelist. If you want to use your organisation’s own list of internal sector classifications, select the option: ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’.

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: vocabulary uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: If you have chosen to use an internal sector classification codelist, provide a link to where this is defined.

code.name: code
code.label: code
code.hover_text: Select the sector that the transaction’s funds are supporting. You must only choose one sector from each list that you use.

text.name: text
text.label: code
text.hover_text: Select the sector that the transaction’s funds are supporting. You must only choose one sector from each list that you use.

category_code.name: category_code
category_code.label: code
category_code.hover_text: Select the sector that the transaction’s funds are supporting. You must only choose one sector from each list that you use.

sdg_goal.name: sdg_goal
sdg_goal.label: code
sdg_goal.hover_text: Select the sector that the transaction’s funds are supporting. You must only choose one sector from each list that you use.

sdg_target.name: sdg_target
sdg_target.label: code
sdg_target.hover_text: Select the sector that the transaction’s funds are supporting. You must only choose one sector from each list that you use.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: If you have chosen a sector from an internal sector classification codelist, please provide a description of this sector.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

recipient_country.name: recipient_country
recipient_country.label: recipient-country
recipient_country.hover_text: A country that will benefit from this transaction. If a specific country is not known, or if multiple countries are relevant, a region can be specified instead.

country_code.name: country_code
country_code.label: code
country_code.hover_text: Select a country benefitting from this transaction's funds.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Add an optional name or description of the country benefitting from the activity.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

recipient_region.name: recipient_region
recipient_region.label: recipient region
recipient_region.hover_text: If you cannot identify a specific country benefitting from this transaction, you can provide a region instead.

region_vocabulary.name: region_vocabulary
region_vocabulary.label: vocabulary
region_vocabulary.hover_text:
You can select regions from the 'OECD DAC', 'UN' or your own internal codelist. IATI recommends that you use the 'OECD DAC' codelist. If you do not choose an option, then the codelist 'OECD DAC' is assumed.

Click here for more information on these codelists.

region_code.name: region_code
region_code.label: code
region_code.hover_text: Select the region benefitting from this activity. If vocabulary ‘99 - Reporting Organisation' has been selected, enter a code from your own region list.

custom_code.name: custom_code
custom_code.label: code
custom_code.hover_text: Select the region benefitting from this activity. If vocabulary ‘99 - Reporting Organisation' has been selected, enter a code from your own region list.

vocabulary_uri.name: vocabulary_uri
vocabulary_uri.label: vocabulary-uri
vocabulary_uri.hover_text: If you have selected the vocabulary ‘99 - Reporting Organisation’, provide a link to where this internal list is defined.

narrative.name: narrative
narrative.label: narrative
narrative.hover_text: Add an optional name or description of the region benefitting from the activity.

language.name: language
language.label: language
language.help_text: If no language is selected, your default language is assumed.

flow_type.name: flow_type
flow_type.label: flow type
flow_type.hover_text:
Flow type is a way to categorise financial flows. It distinguishes between official development assistance (ODA), other official flows (OOF), or several types of private flows.

Click here for more information

flow_type.name: flow_type
flow_type.label: code
flow_type.hover_text: Select a flow type, if applicable to this transaction. This is only needed if it is different to the default flow type of the activity as a whole.

finance_type.name: finance_type
finance_type.label: finance type
finance_type.hover_text:
The financial instrument that is being used for this activity. For example, financing is most commonly delivered as a grant or a loan.

Click here for more information

finance_type.name: finance_type
finance_type.label: code
finance_type.hover_text: Select a finance type, if applicable to this transaction. This is only needed if it is different to the default finance type of the activity as a whole.

aid_type.name: aid_type
aid_type.label: aid type
aid_type.hover_text:
The type of aid being supplied (project-type intervention, budget support, debt relief, etc.).

Click here for more information

aid_type_vocabulary.name: aid_type_vocabulary
aid_type_vocabulary.label: vocabulary
aid_type_vocabulary.hover_text: Select a list that includes the aid type for your transaction, if applicable.

aid_type_code.name: aid_type_code
aid_type_code.label: code
aid_type_code.hover_text: Select an aid type, if applicable to this transaction. This is only needed if it is different to the default aid type of the activity as a whole.

earmarking_category.name: earmarking_category
earmarking_category.label: code
earmarking_category.hover_text: Select an aid type, if applicable to this transaction. This is only needed if it is different to the default aid type of the activity as a whole.

earmarking_modality.name: earmarking_modality
earmarking_modality.label: code
earmarking_modality.hover_text: Select an aid type, if applicable to this transaction. This is only needed if it is different to the default aid type of the activity as a whole.

cash_and_voucher_modalities.label: code
cash_and_voucher_modalities.name: cash_and_voucher_modalities
cash_and_voucher_modalities.hover_text: Select an aid type, if applicable to this transaction. This is only needed if it is different to the default aid type of the activity as a whole.

tied_status.name: tied_status
tied_status.label: tied status
tied_status.hover_text:
Whether funding is untied, tied, or partially tied. Tied funding must be spent on goods or services procured from a particular country or group of countries.

Click here for more information

tied_status_code.name: tied_status_code
tied_status_code.label: code
tied_status_code.hover_text: Select a tied status, if applicable to this transaction. This is only needed if it is different to the default tied status of the activity as a whole.
